ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Ulysses COSPIN/HET Daily Average Proton and Helium Fluxes in ASCII Format
ResourceHeader.Description: Daily average PHA-based proton and helium fluxes and errors from the COSPIN High Energy Telescope (HET) in the approximate energy ranges 39-70 MeV/n and 71-94 MeV/n from Day 296, 1990 through Day 60, 2008
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge the COSPIN PI (R.B. McKibben)

InformationURL.Name: User Notes file for COSPIN/HET data files
InformationURL.Description: The User Notes file at the Ulysses Data System (UDS) describes the format of the ASCII data files containing daily average PHA-based fluxes and errors for protons and helium in two energy intervals covering the approximate energy ranges 39-70 and 71-94 MeV/n based on observations from Ulysses COSPIN High Energy Telescope (HET).

AccessURL.Name: Ulysses COSPIN/HET Daily Proton and Helium Fluxes
AccessURL.Description: ASCII file containing all Ulysses COSPIN/HET daily average PHA flux data. Each day is represented by one line containing, in 10 columns Fractional Year - 1900 of midpoint of average (Day 170, 2007 = 107.46438) Fractional Day of Year of midpoint of average (Jan. 1 = 1, so Day 170 = 170.5) Flux of 39-70 MeV Protons Statistical Error on Flux of 39-70 MeV Protons Flux of 71-94 MeV Protons Statistical Error on Flux of 71-94 MeV Protons Flux of 39-71 MeV/n Helium Statistical Error on Flux of 39-71 MeV/n Helium Flux of 71-94 MeV/n Helium Statistical Error on Flux of 72-95 MeV/n Helium Invalid or missing data are represented by -1.000E+00

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: R.B. McKibben, University of New Hampshire

Parameter.Name: Time for the record
Parameter.Description: Time for the record given in fractional year (-1900) and fractional day of year. The given time represents the middle of the nominal averaging interval.

Parameter.Name: COSPIN/HET 39-70 MeV Proton Flux
Parameter.Description: Flux [1/(s cm^2 sr MeV)] of 39-70 MeV protons averaged over 1 day.
Parameter.Caveats: Energy ranges are approximate, based on a minimum error analysis as a function of spectral form (so-called Bow Tie analysis).. The effective geometric factor and end point energies have been chosen to give minimal dispersion in calculated fluxes over a range of plausible proton spectra using events generated from various spectra by Monte-Carlo simulations. Typical systematic uncertainties resulting from such spectral dependence of the response are of order +/- 10 per cent on the flux, in addition to statistical counting uncertainties..

Parameter.Name: COSPIN/HET 39-70 MeV Proton Flux Statistical Error
Parameter.Description: Square Root of N Statistical Error on Flux [1/(s cm^2 sr MeV)] of 39-70 MeV protons

Parameter.Name: COSPIN/HET 71-94 MeV Proton Flux
Parameter.Description: Flux [1/(s cm^2 sr MeV)] of 71-94 MeV protons averaged over 1 day.
Parameter.Caveats: Energy ranges are approximate, based on a minimum error analysis as a function of spectral form (so-called Bow Tie analysis).. The effective geometric factor and end point energies have been chosen to give minimal dispersion in calculated fluxes over a range of plausible proton spectra using events generated from various spectra by Monte-Carlo simulations. Typical systematic uncertainties resulting from such spectral dependence of the response are of order +/- 10 per cent on the flux, in addition to statistical counting uncertainties..

Parameter.Name: COSPIN/HET 71-94 MeV Proton Flux Statistical Error
Parameter.Description: Square Root of N Statistical Error on Flux [1/(s cm^2 sr MeV)] of 71-94 MeV protons

Parameter.Name: COSPIN/HET 39-71 MeV/nucleon Helium Flux
Parameter.Description: Flux [1/(s cm^2 sr MeV/nucleon)] of 39-71 MeV/nucleon Helium nuclei averaged over 1 day.
Parameter.Caveats: Energy ranges are approximate, based on a minimum error analysis as a function of spectral form (so-called "Bow Tie analysis") wherein the effective geometric factor and end point energies are chosen to give minimal dispersion in calculated fluxes over a range of plausible proton spectra using events generated from various spectra by Monte-Carlo simulations. Typical systematic uncertainties resulting from such spectral dependence of the response are of order +/- 10 per cent on the flux, in addition to statistical counting uncertainties..

Parameter.Name: COSPIN/HET 39-71 MeV/nucleon Helium Flux Statistical Error
Parameter.Description: Square Root of N Statistical Error on Flux [1/(s cm^2 sr MeV)] of 39-71 MeV/nucleon Helium nuclei

Parameter.Name: COSPIN/HET 72-95 MeV/nucleon Helium Flux
Parameter.Description: Flux [1/(s cm^2 sr MeV)] of 71-95 MeV Helium nuclei averaged over 1 day.
Parameter.Caveats: Energy ranges are approximate, based on a minimum error analysis as a function of spectral form (so-called Bow Tie analysis).. The effective geometric factor and end point energies have been chosen to give minimal dispersion in calculated fluxes over a range of plausible proton spectra using events generated from various spectra by Monte-Carlo simulations. Typical systematic uncertainties resulting from such spectral dependence of the response are of order +/- 10 per cent on the flux, in addition to statistical counting uncertainties..

Parameter.Name: COSPIN/HET 72-95 MeV/nucleon Helium Flux Statistical Error
Parameter.Description: Square Root of N Statistical Error on Flux [1/(s cm^2 sr MeV)] of 72-95 MeV/nucleon Helium nuclei
